translated: The Questions of King Milinda
The Chapter about Nibbāna
The Question about the Heat of the Hell-fire
The King said:
“Revered Nāgasena, you say:

original: ‘pākatikaaggito nerayiko aggi mahābhitāpataro hoti, khuddakopi pāsāṇo pākatike aggimhi🔽pakkhitto divasampi paccamāno na vilayaṁ gacchati, kūṭāgāramattopi pāsāṇo nerayikaggimhi
analyzed: pākatika aggitaḥ nerayikaḥ aggi mahā abhitāpataraḥ hoti khuddakaḥ api pāsāṇaḥ pākatike aggimhi  pakkhittaḥ divasam pi paccamānaḥ na vilayam gacchati kūṭāgāra mattaḥ api pāsāṇaḥ nerayika ggimhi
translated: ‘The fire in the hells is a much greater heat than the ordinary fire. Even a small stone thrown into ordinary fire

original: pakkhitto khaṇena vilayaṁ gacchatī’ti, etaṁ vacanaṁ na saddahāmi, evañca pana vadetha
analyzed: pakkhittaḥ khaṇena vilayam gacchati iti etam vacanam na saddahāmi evam ca pana vadetha
translated: will not be consumed for a day, but a stone the size of a watch-tower thrown into the fire in the hells will be consumed in a moment.’ I do not believe this statement. But if you say:

original: ‘ye ca tattha uppannā sattā, te anekānipi vassasahassāni niraye paccamānā na vilayaṁ
analyzed: ye ca tattha uppannā sattā te anekāni api vassa sahassāni niraye paccamānāḥ na vilaya
translated: ‘The beings who are born there, even though they are being cooked in the hells for many thousands of years, are not consumed

analyzed: gacchanti iti vacanam na sat dahāmi iti
translated: and do not perish,’ I do not believe that statement either.”
The Elder said:

original: “taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, yā tā santi makariniyopi susumāriniyopi kacchapiniyopi moriniyopi kapotiniyopi, kiṁ nu tā kakkhaḷāni pāsāṇāni sakkharāyo ca khādantī”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi mahā rāja yā tā santi makariniyopi susumāriniyopi kacchapiniyopi moriniyopi kapotiniyopi kim nu tā kakkhaḷāni pāsāṇāni sakkharāyo ca khādanti iti
translated: “What do you think about this, sire? Are there not some fish called makara, susumāra, kacchapa, moray, and dove, which eat hard stones and gravel?”
“Yes, revered sir, they do.”

original: “Kiṁ pana tāni tāsaṁ kucchiyaṁ koṭṭhabbhantaragatāni vilayaṁ gacchantī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana tāni tāsam kucchiyam koṭṭhabbha antara gatāni vilayam gacchanti iti
translated: “But do they dissolve in the womb?”
“Yes, they do, venerable sir.”

original: “Yo pana tāsaṁ kucchiyaṁ gabbho, sopi vilayaṁ gacchatī”ti?
analyzed: yaḥ pana tāsam kucchiyam gabbho saḥ api vilayam gacchati iti
translated: “But does the embryo dissolve too?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“For what reason?”

analyzed: maññāmi bhante kamma adhikatena na vilayam gacchati iti
translated: “I think, venerable sir, that it does not dissolve because of the predominance of kamma.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, kammādhikatena nerayikā sattā anekānipi vassasahassāni niraye paccamānā na vilayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja kamma adhika tena nerayikāḥ sattāḥ anekāni api vassa sahassāni niraye paccamānāḥ na vilayam gacchanti
translated: “So too, sire, beings in hell, because of the predominance of kamma, are not dissolved even though they are being boiled in hell for many a thousand years.
And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘so na tāva kālaṁ karoti, yāva na taṁ pāpakammaṁ byantīhotī’”ti.
analyzed: saḥ na tāva kālam karoti yāva na tam pāpa kammam byantīhoti iti
translated: ‘He does not die until that evil deed has been exhausted.’“
“Please give me another illustration.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, yā tā santi sīhiniyopi byagghiniyopi dīpiniyopi kukkuriniyopi, kiṁ nu tā kakkhaḷāni aṭṭhikāni maṁsāni khādantī”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññasi mahā rāja yā tā santi sīhiniyopi byagghiniyopi dīpiniyopi kukkuriniyopi kim nu tā kakkhaḷāni aṭṭhikāni masāni khādanti iti
translated: “What do you think about this, sire? Do those lionesses, tigresses, hyenas and bitches eat the hard bones?”
“Yes, venerable sir, they do.”

original: “Kiṁ pana tāni tāsaṁ kucchiyaṁ koṭṭhabbhantaragatāni vilayaṁ gacchantī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana tāni tāsam kucchiyam koṭṭhabbha antara gatāni vilayam gacchanti iti
translated: “But do they dissolve in the stomach?”
“Yes, venerable sir.”

original: “Yo pana tāsaṁ kucchiyaṁ gabbho, sopi vilayaṁ gacchatī”ti?
analyzed: yaḥ pana tāsam kucchiyam gabbho saḥ api vilayam gacchati iti
translated: “But does the embryo dissolve too?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“For what reason?”

analyzed: maññāmi bhante kamma adhikatena na vilayam gacchati iti
translated: “I think, venerable sir, that it does not dissolve because of the predominance of kamma.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, kammādhikatena nerayikā sattā anekānipi vassasahassāni niraye paccamānā na vilayaṁ gacchantī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja kamma adhika tena nerayikāḥ sattāḥ anekāni api vassa sahassāni niraye paccamānāḥ na vilayam gacchanti iti
translated: “So too, sire, beings in hell, because of the predominance of kamma, are not dissolved even though they are burning in hell for many a thousand years.”
“Please give me another illustration.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, mahārāja, yā tā santi yonakasukhumāliniyopi khattiyasukhumāliniyopi
analyzed: tam kim maññasi mahā rāja yā tā santi yonaka sukhu māliniyaḥ api khattiya sukhu māliniyaḥ api
translated: “What do you think about this, sire? Those women who are delicate, delicate of foot,

original: brāhmaṇasukhumāliniyopi gahapatisukhumāliniyopi, kiṁ nu tā kakkhaḷāni khajjakāni
analyzed: brāhmaṇa sukhu māliniyaḥ api gahapati sukhu māliniyaḥ api kim nu tā kakkhaḷāni khajjakāni
translated: whether they are women of the royal family, or women of the warrior-nobles, or women of the brahmins, or women of the householders—are they able to eat coarse food,
meat and hard-baked cakes?”
“Yes, venerable sir, they are able to eat them.”

original: “Kiṁ pana tāni tāsaṁ kucchiyaṁ koṭṭhabbhantaragatāni vilayaṁ gacchantī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana tāni tāsam kucchiyam koṭṭhabbha antara gatāni vilayam gacchanti iti
translated: “But do they dissolve in the womb?”
“Yes, venerable sir.”

original: “Yo pana tāsaṁ kucchiyaṁ gabbho sopi vilayaṁ gacchatī”ti?
analyzed: yaḥ pana tāsam kucchiyam gabbho saḥ api vilayam gacchati iti
translated: “But does the embryo dissolve too?”
“No, venerable sir.”
“For what reason?”

analyzed: maññāmi bhante kamma adhikatena na vilayam gacchati iti
translated: “I think, venerable sir, that it does not dissolve because of the predominance of kamma.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, kammādhikatena nerayikā sattā anekānipi vassasahassāni niraye paccamānā na vilayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja kamma adhika tena nerayikāḥ sattāḥ anekāni api vassa sahassāni niraye paccamānāḥ na vilayam gacchanti
translated: “So too, sire, beings in hell, though they are being roasted in hell for many a thousand years, do not dissolve because of the predominance of kamma.
And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘so na tāva kālaṁ karoti, yāva na taṁ pāpakammaṁ byantīhotī’”ti.
analyzed: saḥ na tāva kālam karoti yāva na tam pāpa kammam byantīhoti iti
translated: ‘He does not die until that evil deed has been exhausted.’“
“You are dexterous, revered Nāgasena.”
Question six on the heat of the fire in hell.
